title: Boris Johnson faces splits between Downing Street and Cabinet over election plan
text:
Splits have emerged among Boris Johnson’s Cabinet and Downing Street aides over whether to push for a snap election or try one more time to get the Brexit deal through Parliament.

The Prime Minister’s most senior adviser, Dominic Cummings, wants Mr Johnson to call a vote on an election as soon as the EU grants an expected extension to Article 50, with Nov 28 or Dec 5 pencilled in as the likely dates.

But his Chief of Staff, Sir Edward Lister, is understood to favour accepting a short Brexit delay to get the Prime Minister’s deal through Parliament before taking the victory into a mid-December election.

Similar divisions have emerged among Cabinet ministers, some of whom have warned the Prime...
description: Splits have emerged among Boris Johnson’s Cabinet and Downing Street aides over whether to push for a snap election or try one more time to get the Brexit deal through Parliament.
